item.title: Jefferson add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "One of the strongest motives that lead men to art and science is escape from everyday life with its painful crudity and hopeless dreariness, from the fetters of one's own ever-shifting desires. A finely tempered nature longs to escape from the personal life into the world of objective perception and thought." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jefferson add a quote by Gloria Steinem
item.description: "The truth will set you free, but first it will piss you off." -- Gloria Steinem

item.title: Jefferson add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you feel in your heart to be right – for you’ll be criticized anyway." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Jefferson add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "The deadliest bullshit is odorless, and transparent." -- William Gibson

item.title: Jefferson add a quote by Frida Kahlo
item.description: "I drank to drown my sorrows, but the damned things learned how to swim." -- Frida Kahlo

item.title: Jefferson add a quote by Joan Crawford
item.description: "I find suggestion a hell of a lot more provocative than explicit detail. You didn't see Clark[Gable] and Vivien[leigh] rolling around in bed in Gone With The Wind, but you saw that shit eating grin on her face the next morning and you knew damned well she'd gotten properly laid." -- Joan Crawford

item.title: Jefferson add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "If you end up with a boring miserable life because you listened to your mom, your dad, your teacher, your priest, or some guy on television telling you how to do your shit, then you deserve it." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Jefferson add a quote by Richard Pryor
item.description: "You can't talk about fucking in America, people say you're dirty. But if you talk about killing somebody, that's cool." -- Richard Pryor

item.title: Jefferson add a quote by Anthony Hopkins
item.description: "I once asked a Jesuit preist what was the best short prayer he knew. He said "Fuck it." as in "Fuck it, it's in Gods hands." -- Anthony Hopkins

item.title: Jefferson add a quote by William Morris
item.description: "With the arrogance of youth, I determined to do no less than to transform the world with Beauty. If I have succeeded in some small way, if only in one small corner of the world, amongst the men and women I love, then I shall count myself blessed, and blessed, and blessed, and the work goes on." -- William Morris
